She decided to take out a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional products to sell in her village, such as soft drinks, breads and biscuits. She wishes to earn a higher income from the business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell in her village

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita manages her three-hectare rice field and her one-hectare corn farm. She is 44 years of age and married with two children.

Jovita has been running her rice and corn fields for almost 21 years. She is aiming to increase her yields this next crop season because their household expenses are increasing and so are the allowances of her children. Despite her difficulties on the farm, she still endures all those things in order to obtain a higher income.

With her determination to improve her rice production, she is applying for a loan of PHP 20,000. She intends to use her requested loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, corn seeds, herbicides and insecticides. Some will be used to pay for the labor cost of  hired laborers to plant her farmland. Jovita hopes that she can make her farming business more profitable so that she can let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seeds, herbicides, and insecticides and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie believes that facing the future is not easy. Lennie is 24 years of age, married, and has one child. Lennie has been managing her sari-sari (variety) store business for over five years. She usually sells spices, snack foods, beverages and noodles.

Lennie wish to expand the business thru extending the range of products she sells in their village. That’s why she is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy additional items to sell like eggs, coffee, milk and sugar. Lennie hopes to continue to operate the business and meet the demands of her customers and create good service for them.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, coffee, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene engages in farming, which involves planting and harvesting rice in her field within her village. Irene manages her one hectare of rice. She is helped by her husband in managing their farm. 

Irene is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Farming is the main source of income of her family. She successfully sends her children to school through the profit she gained from farming. That’s why Irene is proud to share that she and her husband are farmers.

Irene wishes that she could borrow a loan that has a minimal interest rate. She chooses our organization because she believes that it will help her to finance her farming needs. Irene decided to borrow a loan of P27,000 to purchase rice seeds to grow and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 27-year-old man and is married with two sons. He is a construction worker and his wife is a school teacher, and both have decent salaries, but not enough to cover the family's needs. Fadi's wife wants to get a new computer at home to help her do exercises and search for different topics related to her work. Fadi is requesting a 1,100 USD loan from FATEN to help his wife cover the costs of purchasing a new computer. This will improve Fadi's wife's teaching skills and create a better life and work conditions for her. Fadi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 46 years old and blessed with three children. He supports his family through his farm. He manages a half-hectare rice field. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to have additional working capital. This loan will help to continue with his business so that it can become more profitable. 

He wants to send all his children to school and for them to get degrees so that they will not be like him, who suffers a lot in order to provide for their basic needs. He has promised to himself that he will do everything he can for the welfare of his children.

loans.use: to have additional working capital.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
At his age, Roman is getting old. He is 59 years old, married, and has five adult-age children. Roman’s wife is a housekeeper. His goal is maintaining his crop's good quality and sell them at a good price.

Roman manages his rice farming business. He has been in this business for 40 years. He is happy to share that through farming, he sustained his family's needs. That’s why even though he is getting old, Roman continues working in his farm.

With the high cost of farm inputs at this time, Roman is asking for a loan of P27,000 to buy farm inputs needed in rice farming like fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. Roman hopes to maintain the business until he has the energy to do farm activities.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed in rice farming like fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man. For the past seven years, Mohammad has had a store for selling clothes, which has been a profitable project. Mohammad wants to purchase clothes in bulk for the winter season, so he will have a better range to resell and increase his income. 

Mohammad has an amount of money which is not enough to cover the costs of purchasing, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to pay. This will offer him a wider assortment and allow him to compete with others well which will increase sales and improve his income. Mohammad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase  winter clothes in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en: Baker is a 26-year-old single man. He is a worker in a coffee shop with a very decent salary, and he has a stall for selling used home appliances, but also not enough to cover his needs and daily expenses, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing more used home appliances to resell. This will increase sales and improve Baker's income. Baker is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase used home appliances to resell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 44-year-old mother of two children, married to Bruno. Her family is currently living in Villamor Cabarroguis. The village where they live is an agricultural community, where the main source of income for most of the residents comes from rice and corn farming. Her husband is in charge of cultivating their 3.5 hectares of rice fields.

Luisa would like to help her husband provide income to meet the needs of the family, so she patiently runs her hog raising business. She is raising two sows and fattening two to obtain extra income for the education of her two children. She has had this kind of business for almost 15 years. According to her, having a college student results in many expenses due to tuition fees, allowances, and room and board. Though she suffers from hardships and shortages in financial matters; still, she endures it because her main goal is to let her children finish their degree courses. For this reason, Luisa is asking for financial assistance amounting to 10,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be used to buy feed and vaccine needed to raise her hogs. She knows that her sacrifices will lead her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine needed for her hog raising business

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is engaged in agriculture. He keeps cattle and cultivates the land. Domingo is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children. His current income is not enough to sustain the family properly.

Domingo would like to develop his agriculture business and get more income. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase fertilizer and corn seeds.

This loan will help Domingo to earn additional income to pay for his children's education and to ensure a sustainable future for them.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 33-year-old single young man. He is an employee in a private company with a decent salary, which is not enough, however, to cover his needs. Mahmoud wants to help his brother cover his wedding expenses, such as purchasing home furniture and appliances, etc. Mahmoud is requesting a $2,000 US loan from FATEN to help his brother cover the wedding expenses. This will allow his brother to enjoy his wedding day and provide him with better life conditions.

loans.use: To pay for wedding expenses

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
At age 54 in San Vicente, a community located in the outskirts of Tumuini, Maximo has been working as a farmer for 35 years. He grows crops, including vegetables. He is a happily married man.

When he started out farming, it was on a piece of land the government assigned to him, and, since then, he’s worked his parcel proudly with much effort and hard work, generating food for his children. He travels to the town of Tumuini to sell his crops, looking to sell them at a good price in the market. Competition is intense, but he strives until he accomplishes the sale. He returns home with the satisfaction of having gotten a good price for his products.

He is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business. The loan will help him to buy the necessary supplies to produce a good-quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old and lives with her husband in the village of San Vicente, an agricultural area with corn, rice, and different vegetables. Carmen has four children.

Carmen is a housewife who also participates in agriculture. She is asking for a loan to invest in corn and rice seeds and to buy fertilizer. With the help of the loan she will have a better financial standing.

Carmen's dream is to renovate her house to be more comfortable for her family. She has not been presented with any problems. In her free time, she likes to watch television.

With her previous loan, she invested in agriculture. Her family circumstances have improved, and her earnings have been evident because she can contribute to the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie has operated her hog raising business for almost 20 years. She currently raises two piglets and one boar. She is glad because her husband helps her raise the hogs.

Rosemarie, 60 years old, is married and has eight children. With the large size of their household, she and her husband double their time in managing their own businesses. While she is busy feeding her hogs, Rosemarie's husband is also busy cultivating and tending their rice field so that they can have a plentiful harvest next crop season. Though four of her children are married, Rosemarie still aims to increase her income to educate her younger children.

Rosemarie is looking forward to her business' success in the future. To make her dreams come true, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes that this amount will help her improve her business continually, which would allow her to save some money for emergency purposes when she and her husband get weak.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Jyambere/makoro Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste fait partie du groupe Jyambere makoro. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Baptiste est cultivateur de pomme de terre. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre, des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture et cherche le marche pour ses produits. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Baptiste voudrait  un jour être le grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’avoir sa propre maison, de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste, age 28, is a member of Jyambere / makoro Group. He's married and has two children, age 3 and 6. One of them attends school. His own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Jean Baptiste is a potato cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, to be used to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers, and pay for workforce.

His strategy for growing his business is to modernize his farming practices, and to look for markets for his products. In the forthcoming years, he would like to become a big merchant.

With his profits, he intends to get his own house, send his children to school, and improve their well-being.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers, and pay for workforce

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila, 45 years old, is married and the mother of two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a Ministry of Education employee with a decent salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Leila has a cultural center where she gives private lessons to students. She wants to improve her center by purchasing new computers for the students who come to the center to use to improve their skills. Leila doesn't have enough money to pay for the computers, so she is requesting a $3,000 US loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new computers and improving the center. This will increase Leila's income and improve the family's living conditions. Leila is a conservative woman, so her husband Anwar is photographed instead in her cultural center.

loans.use: To purchase new computers for her cultural center

loans.name: Twitezimbere/gsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Pierre fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Gsz. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 5 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Pierre est cultivateur de pomme de terre. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre, des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture et cherche le marche pour ses produits. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Pierre voudrait être le grand agri-éleveur et être le distributeur des produits agricoles. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Pierre is a member of the Twitezimbere/Gsz Group.  He is 28 years old, married, with four children ranging between 5 and 9 years old.  Two of his children attend school.  Jean Pierre completed six years of primary school. He is a potato farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy potato seeds, chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor.  His strategy to promote the growth of his business is to modernize his agriculture and to seek a market for his crops.  In the coming years Jean Pierre would like to be a great farmer-producer and a distributor of agricultural products.  With the profits, he is planning to send his children to school and improve their well-being.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo always wishes for a better way of living for his family. He strives to bestow their needs. Leo, 32 years old, is married and blessed with two school-aged children. Leo’s priority in life is to prepare for his children's education.

Leo has operated a rice farming business since he got married. His wife is a housekeeper. Leo’s goal in every crop is to get a high yield and to earn profit to support his family's needs. Leo is seldom seen in their village going to neighbors and having fun. You can see him instead on his farm every day visiting his crops to assure that they are in good condition.

Leo is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and herbicides for plant care. Leo believes that applying the required fertilizers on his crops will give him a better yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the village of San Vicente in Isabela Province. Janet grows corn and rice.

Janet is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for five years. She buys her supplies in her town and sells her products in the market in the same place.

Janet will use the loan that she requested to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow corn and rice. The loan will help her to increase her income, which means she will be able to help her family and to invest. Her dream is to finish the construction of her own home.

In her free time, Janet enjoys resting and walking in their community.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en: Angelito is a humble man who is 30 years of age. He has two grown up children and is married to Vesusa. He is a farmer in the San Vicente province of Isabela. His plan for his family is to improve their quality of life. He’s been a farmer for a long time. He’s very happy with the support he gets from Kiva funds because he was able to use the loan amounting PHP 35,000 to plant larger areas of corn and rice crops as well as to fertilize a great part of the established plants which led to very satisfactory results. His greatest dream is to be able to finish his house to enjoy greater well being.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est né au Rwanda et a 38 ans. Il est marie avec 4 enfants de 9 mois à 12  ans, dont 2 scolarises.il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est commerçant. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter des marchandises de  boutique (4 sacs de  sucre, 10kgs de miel, jus, huile de cuisine, des mayonnaise etc.…)

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir son stock pour pouvoir satisfaire ses marchés. Emmanuel voudrait être un grand commerçant en matière d’alimentation, donc d’avoir un jour l’alimentation (supermarket). Avec le profit  Emmanuel voudrait scolarise ses enfants  et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in Rwanda and is 38 years old.  He is married with four children from 9 months to 12 years old, two of whom are in school; he also has one other person in his care besides his children.  He has three years of secondary education.

Emmanuel is a shopkeeper.  This is his second loan with ACB.  He is going to buy food products for sale (4 bags of sugar, 10 kg of honey, juice, cooking oil, mayonnaise, etc.).

His business growth strategy is to increase his inventory to better satisfy his markets.  Emmanuel would like to be a large-scale food seller and to one day have a supermarket.  With the profits, he would like to pay for his children's schooling and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy food products (4 bags of sugar, 10 kg of honey, juice, cooking oil, mayonnaise, etc.).

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in Rang-ay, Cabatuan, where he manages their rice field. He has been farming for ten years. He made 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) with his last crop. He is thankful because the income he generates from his business helps to provide for the family's daily needs and allows him to continue sending his children to school. Now, Noel is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested, and he is promising to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. She's been growing rice and corn for the last seven years. In the agricultural sector in their village  rice and corn are very popular products. Mary Ann usually sells her crops in the market as well as to neighbors. Now Mary Ann wants to increase the amount she sells. She needs additional capital of P 25,000 to invest in her business to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her farm business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan lives at Peñablanca with his spouse and three children. He cultivates a one-hectare corn field and the income serves as their source of livelihood. They have been planting and harvesting corn 10 years now. He still aspires to improve his crop output so he is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy pesticides and herbicides use in farming. He is hoping that someday they will live comfortably and keep growing as a successful farmers.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and herbicides to use in farming.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en:
Policarpio, 56 years old, chose to be single. He owns and manages a rice farming business to earn a living and support some of his brothers and sisters in their financial needs. He has been a farmer for almost 28 years and usually earns a profits of PHP 23,000 every harvest season. 

Policarpio plans to increase his yields and income to renovate their house and save for future emergencies. But due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy the needed agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and pesticides, to ensure a high production. Policarpio believes that he will be able to increase his yields and income as he continues to work hard and make improvements to his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming

loans.name: Shalimar

texts.en:
Shalimar, 43 years of age, is a hardworking and honest woman. She is married and is a loving mother of two children. She operates an eatery business to support her family, earning PHP 5,000 every month.

Shalimar's income is insufficient due to the high cost of foods to cook, school fees and allowances for her children and paying her employee's salary. She therefore decided to ask for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase meat, vegetables, soy sauce, vinegar and ketchup used for her business. With these products, she hopes to increase her proceeds every month in order to be able to meet her expenses and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, soy sauce, vinegar and ketchup

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is a 34-year-old man who engages in farming and has four years of experience in this field. Dominador is married and has two children.  He raises and sells corn, rice and vegetables, and his cropping income from this business is PHP 20,000. 

Dominador applied for this PHP 25,000 loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Dominador has a good client history

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor lives with his wife, parents and children. He has been engaged in agriculture for 12 years. Nestor would now like to develop his farm. With the help of this loan, he will purchase fertilizer and corn and rice seeds for his farming business. Nestor's children are growing, and so are their needs. Nestor wants to insure his family is fed and his children are educated. Developing his farm will help Nestor implement these goals.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sotero

texts.en: Sotero is a 54-year-old Filipino man who lives with his wife and five school-age children. There is no doubt that he has a huge responsibility as the main source of income for his large family. Sotero has owned a plot of land in his town since 2005. He cultivates rice and corn. Today, he is asking to borrow 40,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva's partner to purchase seed, fertilizer, pesticides and tools to prepare the land for crops. In the future, he plans to use advanced farming techniques and methods in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business

loans.name: Jofeline

texts.en:
Jofeline is 38 years old, and lives with her family including her husband and two children.  She is a woman who remains lively and innovative. She has worked throughout her life to give her family a good quality of life. The fact is, she opened a store in their home offering a variety of basic needs six years ago. She works hard for her business.

She realizes that the most important thing in the business is customers because they are the lifeblood of business. She always tries to give the best service for them in order to gain the lead over her competitors. And to make it possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, sweet bread, coffee, drinks, candies, detergent and other items that are attractive to her customers. This way, she hopes to enhance the quality of life of her family which is the most important thing to her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, sweet bread, and other items that are attractive.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: At the age of 53, Celia still strives hard to earn an income. She has a retail store and saves profits from it for the daily meals of the family. She had two grown up children with their own employment, but she does not want to rely on their remittances. As of now, Celia wants to increase her income so she is asking for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, milk, coffee and sugar to sell in her small store. With her patience and hard work, she is confident that someday they can achieve a successful life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, coffee and sugar to sell in her small store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita had an early marriage. At the age of 28, she already has two children. She is married to Edgardo, a tricycle operator in their village. The daily income from the business goes for meals, school expenses and allowances for her children. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to pay for a driver's license renewal and to buy side mirrors for the motorcycle. Anita hopes that her spouse can safely provide motorcycle transport services daily and finally achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to pay for a driver's license renewal and buy side mirrors for the motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is well known to be a patient and helpful mother. She is married to a farmer; thus, helps her spouse with farming activities such as planting and harvesting corn to sell. They are able to provide sustenance to the family through farming. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. She promises to repay her loan on time, and, hopefully, she can make her crop more profitable to save profits for her family's future expenses and the college education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Delaila

texts.en:
Delaila is proud that she is married to Tito, a loving and hardworking man. Delaila has one child, the fruit of her love with her husband. Delaila describes herself as faithful, God-fearing and God-serving. Her husband sells dry goods such as beans, cooking oil and eggs, using their tricycle.

With her passion to succeed, Delaila engages herself in her hog raising business. She is thankful for her business, which is her source of income. With the high cost of feed in the market, Delaila feels worried because she might not be able to continue her business because of lack of funds. Delaila wishes to borrow PHP 40,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes to maintain and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah, a 52-year-old woman, is married with five sons and three daughters. Her husband is a guard at one of the buildings, making a decent salary. It is not enough to cover his family's needs. Najah wants to make some repairs to her house, such as painting. So she is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of painting her house and improving its condition. This will create better and healthier conditions at home for the family. Najah is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for painting her house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 51 years old, married and has six children ranging from fifteen to twenty-six. She describes herself as an organised and determined woman. She runs a  grocery store and sells tomatoes, onions, kale and fish. In addition, she also does farming to increase her income. She will be using the KES 20,000 loan to buy more of the vegetables that she sells. In the next five years, Margaret wants to be a wholesale supplier of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 35-year-old single young woman. Her family works in agriculture with a low income.  For the past 10 years, Amneh's brother has also had a grocery store selling grocery products, which has been a profitable project but not enough to cover the family's needs.

Amneh is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her brother cover the costs of purchasing more groceries and improving the store's condition by painting, installing a new door,etc. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Amneh is a conservative woman, so her brother Khaled is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell and to improve the store conditions

loans.name: Joffer

texts.en:
Joffer's family is less fortunate. This drives him to work hard in order to provide better living condition for his family. He has been into planting corn, in his hectare cornfield, for 10 years now. 

Joffer is married and has two children. His spouse works as housekeeper. He is now asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to have additional capital towards buying seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. 

Joffer is praying for good health in order to continuously generate income for the betterment of his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami, who is a 30-year-old young man, is married with one son and one daughter. He is a taxi driver with a low income that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Sami wants to complete building his house by purchasing the necessary construction supplies, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies to complete building the house. This will improve the family's living conditions. Sami is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to complete building his house

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, who is a 29-year-old young woman, is married with two sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Fatmeh wants to have a computer in her house so she can enhance her skills in using a computer and have contact with others through it, so she is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing a new computer. This will improve her skills in using a computer. Fatmeh is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is a simple, yet proud, farmer who lives at Baliuag with his wife and three children. He is planting and harvesting corn for future sale to traders in the village where they live. His spouse also helps him to plant corn seeds. Corn farming is the family's primary source of income. 

Jeffrey has decided to take a loan from ASKI to have additional capital towards buying inputs necessary for farming. He will buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow.

With God's guidance, he assures us that someday he will give a fortunate life to his family, especially a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
To generate income, Maricel engages in cooking and selling of meals and snacks in her eatery. She is 28 years old and still single. Her ambition in life is to become financially stable before she gets married. At present, she is helping her parents in financing the education of her younger sisters. 

She aims to improve her small eatery by serving more recipes to satisfy her customers demand. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of P10,000 to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in her eatery. She believes that she can make an improvement in her business, despite the problems and difficulties she encountered in life.

loans.use: to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in her  eatery

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 23-year-old young single man. Five years ago he opened a grocery store located in a vital area next to a main street. It is a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but not enough to cover all his needs.

Abdullah wants to purchase necessary groceries for sale and wants to cover the expenses for repairing the store such as painting, installing additional shelves and lights, so he is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more groceries and for improving the store's condition. This will increase sales and improve Abdullah's income. Abdullah is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and make some repairs to the store

loans.name: Jonel

texts.en:
Jonel finished his high school level of education. But he did not have the opportunity to enter college because his parents have no capacity to send him. Jonel wants to prove that he can succeed even though he did not reach the highest level of education.
Jonel is married and blessed with two children. His wife engages in the retail business. Jonel has run a pig raising business since he got married. He started his business with just two piglets. He manages the business well, combining hard work and passion to succeed.
Jonel's goal in life is to continue growing the business and to be able to give his children the opportunity of the highest level of education. Jonel is asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy feed for his pigs. He believes that through the loan he will turn his goal into reality.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
"Through patience and hard work" James believes that he will be able to improve his family's status of living and give them a better life. He is 22 years old and has two infants. James owns and manages a rice farming business, which is his major source of income. He plans to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production and to increase his income to satisfy his family's needs and save for his children's future.

James is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy needed agricultural inputs for his rice farming business to ensure a plentiful harvest. He mentioned that the loan will help him to work out his plan. He hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 50 years old and has one child. She is married to a tricycle driver who patiently has provided transport services at the nearby village for almost three years now. Erlinda would like to improve her husband's transport services, so she is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 for license renewal and to buy new tires for the motorcycle. New tires will help to ensure safety of passengers and the safety of her spouse's life too. Erlinda hopes to make their business profitable so that someday, they will be one of the more successful entrepreneurs in their place of residence.

loans.use: to pay for license renewal and to buy new tires for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and five children. She has a variety store in their village where she sells toys, women's accessories, plastic wares and other tools. She also operates her fish ball stand nearby her store, as an additional source of income. Her business-mindedness began five years ago and luckily her business flows accordingly. But due to some calamities that occured in their region, she was not able to deliver her orders and it caused a drop in sales. 

For this reason, she aimed to make the deliveries herself.  To make her dream possible, she is requesting a loan of P12,000 to purchase additional toys, tools and accessories to offer. She’s looking forward to this season, she would earn good profit. In this way, she could save for the attainment if her dream.

loans.use: to purchase additional toys, tools and accessories to offer

loans.name: Nyakisi Group

texts.en:
Bonifance is forty years old with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children up to University level.

He has been distilling alcohol for the last ten years and there is a ready market for his product. He has a challenge because of price fluctuations. His dream is to expand his business into new markets. Bonifance needs the loan facility to pay workers who are distilling alcohol for sell. Bonifance belongs to the above mentioned group and only 15 took money and the rest had to guarantee them as per the group policy.

loans.use: to pay workers who are distilling alcohol for sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is patiently providing motorcycle transport services to the people in his village, especially students who go to school. He has been doing this for almost four years now. In this kind of business, he is able to provide daily meals for the family and school expenses for his two children. He is married to Juanita, a housekeeper. 

Roger would like to provide his services more efficiently and safely, so he is asking for a loan to buy a new pair of tires and side mirrors for the motorcycle. He is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000. 

Roger would like to continuously finance the schooling of his children so they can earn a degree and seek good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy tires and side mirrors for his motorcycle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a business-minded person. She is 36 years of age and a widower. Evelyn is currently living with her three children in the village of Calaocan Santiago.

Evelyn runs an electronics sales and cell phone accessories business. She has been running this kind of business for eight years and she is glad because she is able to earn about PHP 3,000 a month. Evelyn's business is located inside the old public market of Santiago where she has two stalls. She has one stall for her cell phone accessories and one stall for her electronics appliances. Evelyn would like to request financial support due to the unexpected circumstances that happened to her husband. In this situation, her capital is no longer enough to provide for her family needs and cover all her household expenses. Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy electronic appliances such as DVD players, speakers, cell phone accessories and other dry goods for her retail business. She hopes that she can improve her business to be able to obtain greater profits since she is now the breadwinner of the family. She knows that she can make things possible through the guidance of our Almighty God and hard work.

loans.use: to buy electronic appliances such as DVD players, speakers, cell phone accessories and other items for her retail business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 52 years old and a married woman, having two children. She is peacefully residing at Calaocan Santiago with her whole family. Her eldest child is a college student while the youngest is in her high school level of education. Her family's income comes from her husband's salary and her own retailing business.

Luzviminda manages her stall, which is located at public market of Santiago. She offers baked breads and peanut butter to provide for their costs of living. She has had this kind of business for one year and, with the generated income, she is able to support her children's education and improve her family's living conditions. Luzviminda would like to continue improving her business in order to sustain all of her family's needs, most especially to her two children who are still studying. She really needs to work hard to increase her income due to the high cost of basic necessities and the allowances of her children.

With her strong determination, Luzviminda would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP10,000, which will be used to buy more baked breads and peanut butter for her retail stall business. She knows that her patience and determination will lead her to achieve her dreams for her business and for her two children. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy more baked breads and peanut butter for her retail stall business.

loans.name: Diana Rose

texts.en:
At a young age, Diana Rose settled for marriage. She is now 23 years of age and happily married. The couple has been blessed with a healthy girl.

Diana Rose has been running her vegetable stall for four months. She is thankful because her vegetables sell out immediately but during the lean months, she struggles to sell them. Nowadays, she aims to buy more vegetables such as cabbage, string beans and eggplant for her vegetable vending business. To make her aims come true, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000. She believes that through her patience and additional capital, she can obtain income. This would really help her in attaining her success in business. Diana Rose would be glad if her loan is approved. In this way, she can save some and educate her only child.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as cabbage, string beans and eggplant  to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses,shirts and other formal dress items for her clothing sale business.

loans.name: Naseeran's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very efficient and performs her duties very well.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. He also picks up school children from their homes and drops them at school. Due to his good nature and driving skills, the parents of school children send their children with them without any worries.

Nasreen is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her eldest son is also a rickshaw driver while two of her remaining children are studying. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who wants to pay the remaining installments for his auto-rickshaw.

By paying the installments at once, the auto-rickshaw will become his property and he will be able to operate his business worry free.

Nasreen is hopeful that her husband’s income will improve and her family will be able to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To pay the remaining installments for an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Hameedan's Group

texts.en:
Hameedan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty parlor business.  She started her beautician profession a few years ago to financially support her family.

She is very talented in her profession and her clients are very happy with her professional services.
 
With the loan investment she will buy different beauty products such as creams and shampoos in larger quantities and of better quality that will allow her to improve her services further and increase her income.

Along with her business, she also performs her household duties and raises her three daughters and two sons very well.  All of her children are enrolled in the local school and are getting their education.  Hameedan wants them to become successful in life after completing their education.

She is very confident that she will be able to improve her business after investing the loan.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoos and other beauty products for her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Sairah

texts.en:
Sairah operates a cell phone accessories stall. She has been involved in this kind of business since 2001. Sairah is married and blessed with five children. Three of her children are studying and two are still infants.

Sairah would like to ask for financial assistance because her household expenses are continually increasing due to the needs of her growing children. According to her, the stall she operates is not her own. Instead, it is rented. So now, she is facing a financial shortage. Therefore, Sairah is encouraged to borrow additional capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. The loan will be used to buy stock of cell phone accessories, DVD players and speakers to sell in her stall.

Sairah hopes that her success depends on the wise management of her cell phone accessories business, which will enable her to pay her obligation in school and some of their household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
At 36, Wilfredo is married and working hard for the family's sustenance. He is into the food selling business, particularly cooking and selling his speciality, pansit (a common term for noodles topped with eggs, meat and vegetables which is ideal for snacks). He has been operating this kind of business for almost five years. Wilfredo still needs to improve his cooking skills to get more customers and earn more profit. He is now asking for a loan to buy vegetables, noodles and onions to cook and sell on his stall. 

Wilfredo's patience, hard work and faithfulness with God, means someday he will surpass all challenges in his life, and thus achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, noodles and onions to cook and sell on his stall.

loans.name: Rona May

texts.en:
Rona May is a married woman who lives at Maddarulug with her spouse and one child. She did not finish her college education. She needs to earn an income. She is only involved in a business selling "ukay-ukay" (used clothes and shoes) at the public market where the sales opportunity is high. Her income from the business goes for meals, infant formula, milk and diapers for her child.
 
She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more used clothes to sell (including shoes and bags) to increase her income. Someday, she hopes to keep making her business profitable and earn funds to use when her child starts to study.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma has a small store selling grocery items to her neighborhood. Daily profits from the business go towards school expenses and other parts of the profit serve as revolving capital for the business.

Thelma is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, milk, sugar and coffee to sell. 

In the future, she would like to make her business more profitable and someday acquire more profits from in it so that she will be able to save funds for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, milk, sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a small entrepreneur selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her neighborhood. With the income from this business, she was able to provide daily allowances to her three children and daily meals for the family. She is married to a farmer. She decided to borrow a loan amount of PHP 6,000 to have an additional capital for buying cabbages, squash, tomatoes and onions to sell. She wanted to increase the products she sells and increase her earnings too. 

Someday, she would like to have a good financial management so as to ensure the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, squash, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a 51-year-old man who lives with his wife and children. He is a hog raiser and breeder and has four years of experience in this field. Ruben chose this particular activity because meat is in very high demand in their community.

Ruben usually buys piglets in the local market, fattens and raises them for 5-6 months. Then, he resells the grown pig for a more profitable price to market vendors and butchers. His wife helps to look after the animals and feed them. 

Demand for fresh meat is very high and Ruben would like to cover the demand of his permanent clients. For this purpose, he has applied for P 10,000. He will use the loan to buy two piglets.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 44 years old and has three children. She is married to a farmer and to help her spouse generate an income, she sells street foods such as fish balls, hotdogs and squid balls to the people in her neighborhood. With the minimal income of P200 daily from the business, she has been able to provide allowances for her children.

She is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to increase her sales. She will buy hotdogs, fish and chicken balls to sell. She hopes to make her business more profitable for the overall family welfare.

loans.use: to buy hotdogs, fish and chicken balls to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sheep and expand and improve the herd's condition

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single young man. He has a car-wash that is located in a good area. It is a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but it is not enough to cover all life's expenses. 

Mohammad wants to purchase cleaning materials and car oils that are essential for his work in the car-wash. He is therefore requesting a loan of USD 1,000 from FATEN to help him cover the costs and also to improve the car-wash's condition.  This will increase the quantity of work and improve Mohammad's income. Mohammad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning materials and car oils for his car-wash.

loans.name: Seykie

texts.en: Seykie has a store where she sells groceries, soft drinks, canned goods and other products. She needs the loan of P 5,000 to buy more merchandise like rice, sugar and flour to stock her store. Seykie is married and 27 years old. She lives in her own house located in the community of Binarzang province of Isabela.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, drinks and flour for her store.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 56-year-old man who is married with one son and two daughters. He gets a decent pension and in addition has a small grocery store, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses. 

Fouad's son is studying at the university, specializing in Mechanical Engineering. Fouad wants to help his son to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help his son cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for his son and improve the family's living conditions. Fouad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his son.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly is a 32-year-old woman, married, with three school-aged children. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000, because she wants to benefit from the holiday season in order to improve her business. She will do this by purchasing new merchandise, in particular new accessories like jewelry. This will permit her to have enough stock to serve the demands of her customers. She believes her family circumstances have improved as she is currently more economically solvent.

loans.use: to buy additional fashion jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married to a farmer. For the past 10 years, they have both been involved in planting, harvesting and selling corn in order to provide sustenance for her three children's education. 

Myrna is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides. In the future, Myrna hopes to achieve an abundant harvest so that they can earn funds to use in times of crisis. She also would like to save funds for house improvement.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a hog raiser in their village. In this kind of business, he has been able to support his family. He is married and had one infant child. He is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability. He would like to ensure good nutrition for his hogs so that he can get a higher price upon maturity. This will help him strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability.

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Salamat is married and sews clothes to financially contribute to the family. She is very skillful and receives good number of orders every month. She has 5 children. All of them are studying and they also work with Salamat after coming back from school. Her husband is a daily wage laborer.

Salamat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and increase her profits.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for the past many years. She is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and will improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia is 53 years old and has three grown up children. She is married to a farmer. For almost two years, she has been involved in hog-raising as an additional source of income. One of her children also helped her financially in times of need. 

She is now asking for a loan because she had an insufficient fund to sustain her hogs. She needs PHP 6,000 to buy vaccines and hog feed.

She would like that someday their businesses are more profitable than before so that they will earn more income even without the remittances from her child.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and hog feed.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en:
Serapio is a 56-year-old man who breeds pigs and sells them for meat. He has four years of experience in this field. Serapio is an hardworking and very patient person and lives with his family in Binarzang province of Isabela. He has three grown up children. 

Together with his wife and children, Serapio looks after his pigs. His monthly income is PHP 1,500 and he would like to increase it to PHP 5,000. For this purpose, he needs PHP 10,000, which he will spend on buying feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his hog business.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor, 36 years old, is married with two sons. He works selling used home appliances with a low income, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Noor's wife is a university student specialized in Arabic Language. Noor wants to help his wife to continue her studies and graduate to get the first university degree, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help his wife cover the university fees to complete the session. This will create a bright future for his wife and help her to get better job conditions after graduating, so she will share with her husband the task of covering the family's needs and they can live in better conditions. Noor is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his wife.

loans.name: Elias

texts.fr:
Elias est né au Rwanda. Il a 44 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 8 à 22 ans, dont 5 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Elias est agriculteur de pomme de terre. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre, des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture pour élever la production au maximum possible et semer les grains sélectionne (de bonne qualité). Dans les prochaines années, Elias voudrait  devenir un grand vendeur de semence de pomme de terre dans sa région et faire l’agriculture comme profession. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’avoir de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elias was born in Rwanda. He is 44, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 8 and 22, 5 of whom go to school. His education level is 3 years of secondary school.
Elias is a potato farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay his workforce.
His strategy for the growth of his business is to modernize his farming to increase production as much as possible, and to plant (good quality) pedigreed seeds. In the coming years, Elias would like to get into the wholesale of potato seeds in his region and to make farming his profession. With the profits, he plans on sending his children to school and improving the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and to pay his workforce.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth was involved in an early marriage and to supplement the family's income, she raises hogs to sell. Her spouse is a farmer. Elizabeth has been in a hog-raising business for about three years. She earns an income for about P2,00 for each hog sold. 

She is now asking for an additional capital of P5,000 to buy feed and medicines for hog sustainability.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and help make her family economically stable.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hog sustainability

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.fr:
Drocelle  est née au Rwanda et a 46 ans. Elle est mariée avec 2 enfants de 12 à 15 ans, dont 1 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Drocelle est agricultrice. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va acheter des 
Des semences des pommes de terre des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est  modernisée et utiliser le matériels nécessaire pour améliore son agriculture. Drocelle voudrait être une agricultrice moderne et une grande distributrice des produits agricole. Avec le profit  Drocelle voudrait scolarise ses enfants et assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Drocelle was born in Rwanda and is 46. She is married and has 2 children who are 12 and 15, one of whom goes to school. Her education level is 6 years of primary school.

Drocelle is a farmer. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will buy potato seeds, fertilizers and she will pay her workforce.

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to modernize and use the necessary material to improve her farming. Drocelle would like to be a modern farmer and a wholesaler of agricultural products. With the profit, Drocelle would like to send her children to school and to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and she will pay her workforce.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en: Dexter is a very responsible young man aged 23. He raises and sells pigs in the small village of Binarzang in Isabela Province. He has five years of experience in this field. Dexter is not alone in his business, his parents helps him a lot. His earnings from pig selling are PHP 15,000 for three pigs in four months. He works for the well-being of his parents and also for his future. He applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase sacks of feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for his business.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit selling business. He is a very hard worker and always provides high quality fresh fruit to his customers at low prices. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell to his customers and that will increase his sales and profit. He has been operating his business for many years and has vast experience in his field of work. 

Kalsoom is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes in the financial life of her family by increasing her husband’s sales and income. She is very supportive and does decorative embroidery in order to financially support her family. She has given birth to seven children. Her two sons are involved in chicken meat selling business while 2 daughters help her in her embroidery work. Her remaining children are continuing their education.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.fr:
Annonciata  est née au Rwanda et a 34 ans. Elle est mariée avec 2 enfants de 8 à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Elle a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Annonciata est commerçante. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va acheter des 
Blés, maniocs, petit poids pour les revendre dans des marchés locaux.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est  de fournir en grande quantité. Annonciata voudrait être grossiste des produits alimentaire dans tout le pays. Avec le profit  Annonciata voudrait scolarise ses enfants et les soigner.
texts.en:
Annonciata was born in Rwandan and is 34. She is married and has 2 children who are 8 and 10, and who both go to school. In addition to her children, she has one more dependent person. Her education level is 6 years of primary school.

Annonciata is into retail. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will buy wheat, cassava, and peas to sell them at the local markets.

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to be able to provide big quantities. Annonciata would like to be a wholesaler of food products in the entire country. With the profit, Annonciata would like to take care of her children's school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy wheat, cassava, and peas to sell them at the local markets.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is 59 years old. He breeds and raises pigs and has been in business for the last ten years. 

He is married and has one kid. 

Bernardo buys piglets, raises and fattens them, and sells them for a profit every 5 to 6 months. He usually sells them for meat purposes in his community. 

His monthly income is PHP 2,500. His wife helps him run the business. 

Now Bernardo has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase four piglets.

loans.use: to buy piglets for his business.

loans.name: Joenapher

texts.en: Joenapher is 30 years old and has been engaged in pig breeding for the last six years. He usually buys piglets, raises, fattens and then sells them for a profitable price in the next five to six months. His monthly income from his business is PHP 2,000. He sells pigs as meat and this is a very profitable business because people in Binarzang use meat in everyday cooking. To cover market demand Joenapher applied for a loan of PHP 10,000. He will use this loan to purchase feed and vitamins for his hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pig business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hard-working mother who is engaged in a food-vending business to help her husband in financing the needs of her family. Aida aims to improve her small business to satisfy her childrens' basic necessities. 

She cooks and sells different kinds of snacks and street foods in their village, but her capital is not sufficient to acquire the needed ingredients to cook. Therefore, she is asking for additional capital of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy oil, fish balls, hot dogs, and meat to cook and sell in the village. She says that this loan will help her to make the business grow as she continues to work and make an effort.

loans.use: To buy oil, fish balls, hot dogs, and meat to cook and sell.

loans.name: Janvière

texts.fr:
Janvière  est née au Rwanda et a 23 ans. Elle est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire.

Janvière est commerçante. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va acheter des 
Draps des lits et des couvre lits pour les revendre aux marchés locaux. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est  de vendre ses produits aux différents acheteurs dans sa région. Janvière voudrait être une grande commerçante dans sa région. Avec le profit  Janvière voudrait  aider son frère d’étudier.
texts.en:
Janvière was born in Rwanda and is 23. She is single. Her education level is 3 years of secondary school.

Janvière is into retail. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will buy bed sheets and bedspreads to resell them at the local markets.

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to sell these items to the various buyers in her region. She would like to be an established trader in her region. With the profits, Janvière would like to help her brother go to school.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and bedspreads to resell them at the local markets.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a farmer who lives at Baliuag with her spouse and three children. She and her spouse are both involved in planting and harvesting corn for sale. They have been in this business for almost 10 years. She still needs to further develop the business to achieve a higher yield so that she can continuously finance the schooling of her children. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

Someday, she and her spouse would like to raise hogs for an additional income and become successful in all their businesses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Gerard

texts.fr:
Gérard est né au Rwanda. Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 9 à 20 ans, dont 4 scolarisé. Il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Gérard est commerçant. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des pagnes.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de vendre au prix discutable. Dans les prochaines années, Gérard voudrait  devenir un grand commerçant des pagnes. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants et les soignes.
texts.en:
Gérard was born in Rwanda. He is 45, married, has 4 children between the ages of 9 and 20, all of whom go to school. In addition to his children, he has one more dependent person. His education level is 6 years of primary school.

Gérard is into retail. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy pagnes.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to sell at a negotiable price. In the coming years, Gérard would like to get into the wholesale of pagnes. With the profits, he plans on taking care of his children's school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 52-year-old woman who does everything for her family. She is engaged in selling different kinds of vegetables and fruit. She has six adult children who help her in her business to gain profit. She has been in this business for two years, and she earns PHP 200 per day. Erlinda is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional products such as cabbage, squash, beans and different fruits that she can offer in their community.

In the future, Erlinda hopes that she can give her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, squash, beans and a variety of fruits for her business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is married. She is 39 years old. To better support her family, she runs a sari-sari store in the village of Amobocan in the province of Isabela. She has been in this business for four years and earns about PHP 300 a day.

At this time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy groceries such as curls, soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell. She hopes to increase her income to better feed her family and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as curls, soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 32, is from the village of Manaring. She’s married and has seven children. Four of them are already adults and the youngest, a 17-year-old, is attending school. Four of her children still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

As a good wife, Delia tries to help her husband in everything she can. Because of this she’s taking out this loan to help with her husband’s business. He sells fruit and vegetables. He sells four days a week in a market in their town. He heads out to the market very early in order to buy from wholesalers and then sell to people who come to the supply center to buy items for daily consumption.

Delia is requesting the loan in order to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits to give to her husband, so that he can use them in his business. She tells us that, thanks to the loans, they are able to get ahead, and with the profits are able to provide a good education to their children, so that they can have great futures. Her dream is to someday have a clothing store or a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy bamboo shoot, beans, cabbage, and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Claro

texts.en:
Claro is from the town of Cauayan City in the province of Isabela. He is 35 years old. Claro is single and lives with his parents. He is a hard-working and responsible son. Claro owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business is selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.
Right now, Claro has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional stock items for his sari-sari store such as noodles, canned goods, bakery bread, curls, and daily-use products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock items for his sari-sari store, such as noodles, canned goods, bakery bread, curls, and daily-use products to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a very young married woman, and is 19 years old. She is 3 months pregnant and from the village of Manaring province of Isabela. 

Maricel is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy different fish that she can offer to the people in the community. Her spouse works as a farmer, and she wants to help gain profit so that they can save money and build their own house.

loans.use: To buy different fish for her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is thankful because she has been able to run and manage her vegetable stall for six years. She is 47 years of age and married to Eduardo. Her family is residing at the village of Mabini Santiago.The couple is blessed with one child. 

Dominga is facing a shortage of capital from her business due to expensive medicine for her husband and an increase of household expenses. With the situation she is experiencing nowadays, she is encouraged to borrow additional capital from the lenders. 

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used for buying vegetables such as squash, string beans, carrots, cauliflower, radishes, and cabbage for her vegetable stall. Through this additional working capital, she will be able to maintain her business and provide all the medicines needed by her husband for his recovery. Dominga hopes that her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as squash, string beans, carrots, cauliflower, radishes, and cabbage for her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old. She is separated from her husband. She has three years’ experience raising pigs, an activity that has allowed her to raise all her children. Being a single parent is very difficult, but Thelma does her best to meet her children's needs, and she is determined to work hard to lift her family from poor living. 

Thelma is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. She dreams of seeing her business grow and of having a good estate to leave her children with economic stability and good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda said that "Hard work and patience is the ladder in achieving success in life". This characteristic is Erlinda's motivation to herself in managing her retailing business. She offers different kinds of personal products, school supplies, and home decorations. Erlinda has a stall that is located within the public market of Santiago. She has had this kind of business since 1981. She is grateful because her profits have been utilized for her household expenses and education of her children during their school days.

Erlinda is 48 years old. She and her husband Rogelio are blessed with three children. Two of them are settled into marriage and separately living with their own families, while the other one left is still single. Erlinda would like to improve her small business into a larger one because she and her husband are getting older already. She needs to do her best right now since she still has the ability to improve it. With her determination in obtaining her goal, she is asking for financial support from the lenders. 

Erlinda is asking for a loan amounting to 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Through the amount she requests, she could restock her stall. In this way, she could encourage more costumers to buy the products she offers. When this happens, she could save some for her emergency purposes or for when she and her husband get weak, and she could also improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To restock her retailing business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 33 years old and has eight school-aged children. She sells charcoal from 6 am until 6 pm every day.  Mary Ann has five years of experience in this business. 

Mary Ann has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to expand her business by increasing the amount of charcoal she has to sell. To do that, she needs to buy wood and other materials needed for her charcoal-making. With the profit, Mary Ann will be able to reinvest in her business and pay for the school needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy wood and other materials needed for her charcoal-making business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a responsible and jolly person who is engaged in the hog-raising business. Marilyn has been in this business for 12 years; she earns approximately PHP 7,000 per head for these activities. Marilyn is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family out of poverty. She is 34 years old, and is married to a farmer who takes care of and cultivates their farm land. At this time, Marilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines to sustain her hog-raising business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further grow her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines to sustain her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 48 years old and is married. He is engaged in the hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. He has three piglets to raise. Sometimes, Joel has difficulties in feeding his pigs; that’s why he decided to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. Joel will manage his business well and increase his income, saving some of it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for his hogs.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married and has 3 daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

Nusrat is a housewife, and she performs her household duties by staying at home. She is a very efficient lady who takes care of her family very well. Her husband is a carpenter who makes wooden doors. He is known among his customers as an expert in his work, and he receives a good number of orders every month.

Nusrat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who has a large order to fill. With the loan investment, he will purchase wood in larger quantities, which will allow him to make larger and better quality wooden doors to fill the order and increase his profits. He is very experienced and has been operating his business for many years.

Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will help her husband to make his business more profitable in the near future.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy wood for a door-making business.

loans.name: Ruqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqiya has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s barber shop. He started his business a few years ago and now it is well established. Due to the quality of his hair-cutting services, he has a good number of clients in his area. With the loan investment, he will buy scissors and hair-cutting tools of better quality that will allow him to provide even better-quality services to his customers. He will also buy some chairs and other furniture to increase the sitting arrangements for his clients.

Ruqiya is very much hopeful that an investment will help her son improve his business services and increase his income.

Ruqiya is also a working lady and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has given birth to six children; it is her eldest son who operates the barber shop. Her elder daughter also works and helps Ruqiya complete the sewing orders of her clients.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers.

Ruqiya is a very positive-minded lady and very much sure that her son will become more established in his business after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah passbook) is Ruqiya.

loans.use: To buy hair cutting tools and furniture for a barber shop business.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en:
Vanesa is a 23-year-old woman with one infant daughter. She sells different products from a sari-sari store in front of her house. Operating a community based store is the only way Vanesa can make a living. Her store is located in the Binarzang village of the Isabela province. 

Vanesa is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a variety of products such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee and sugar for her store. In the future, she hopes that she can improve her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, coffee and sugar to sell from her store

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man. For three years, he has run a stationery store. It is a profitable enterprise located next to many schools in the area. The store is his only source of income, but his profits are not sufficient to cover all of his needs. Mohammad wants to make some repairs to the store to improve its condition, such as replacing tiles and installing additional shelves, and to purchase additional collections of stationery to sell.
