texts.en: Sevada is a 26-year-old farmer. He lives with his mother and his father, who is a teacher at the local school. Sevada has applied for this loan to develop cattle breeding. With the requested loan he plans to purchase two cows and forage. Sevada plans to start his own family, so with increased income from agriculture he will ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cows.

location.town: Yelpin village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.en: Aghasi trades clothing from a rented booth in the city market. He would like to increase his sales and develop his business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase clothing to sell. This loan will help him to expand his business and to get more income, with which he will ensure a prosperous life for his family. Aghasi lives with his parents and his sister, who is a student.

loans.use: to pay for clothing.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is a school teacher and lives with his wife, who is also a teacher. The family has been engaged in beekeeping for five years. Stepan has applied for this loan to develop his beekeeping. He plans to purchase 15 more beehives, which will allow him to receive more honey. Honey is in great demand not only in the city, but also in the region, so meeting this demand will allow Stepan to increase his income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is a beekeeper who has five beehives. His current income from beekeeping is barely enough to pay for his family's living expenses.

Artak lives with his father, wife and son.  He would like to expand his farm and earn more income. With the help of this loan Artak plans to purchase 15 more beehives. He hopes that expanding his beekeeping operations will allow him to make his farm more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy beehives

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en:
Gaudance, 38, is married. She has five years of experience selling African clothes and currently employs one person to help her.

Gaudance has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more African clothes to sell. With any profits from the loan, Gaudance would like to satisfy her family's basic needs and to start saving for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more African clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes as inventory for a small retail shop

loans.name: Nune

texts.en: Nune runs an Arabian cafe-restaurant “ARABICA” in Yerevan, a business she started in 2010. Nune sells Arabian cocktails, coffee, nargiles (hookah pipes) and so on. She has applied for a loan before, which was successfully paid off. Now, Nune has applied for this loan to enlarge her business and to increase her product assortment. This loan will help her to meet client demand and increase the business income.

loans.use: to pay for products for her cafe.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married, and has  five children. He owns a small shop where he sells soap, bread, rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar and so on. This is his fifth year in business and he works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Joseph has requested a this loan through Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company to buy more cooking oil, bread, books, and soap to sell. He plans to revinvest any profits back into his business and wants to be able to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, bread, books, and soap

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is a seamstress who lives in Yerevan with her husband and son. She has had her business for ten years, and plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy fabric for her business. She needs the new fabric to be able to finish orders for her clients and to get new orders.

Sonya hopes she will be able to grow her business and get more income, which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and make it easier for her to make ends meet.

loans.use: to buy fabric
